title: Alternative to Optima? Humanist Sans?
content:
Looking for alternatives to Optima.

Particularly interested in new/recent releases.
author: cool_hand

comments.content:
Beorcana  
 [http://beorcana.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/beorcana.com/ "http://beorcana.com/")  
 [http://typographica.org/typeface-reviews/beorcana/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/typographica.org/typeface-reviews/beorcana/ "http://typographica.org/typeface-reviews/beorcana/")
thanks, but I am trying to find something that feels a little bit more contemporary.

Not quite contemporary with Optima, a bit earlier, actually, but with a similar mid-century vibe:  
 [http://www.identifont.com/show?8HA](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.identifont.com/show?8HA "http://www.identifont.com/show?8HA")  
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lydian\_(typeface)  
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albertus\_(typeface)

I would suggest you look at Hypatia Sans Pro from Adobe, designed in the last few years by Thomas Phinney and issued in 2007.

[https://www.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/hypatia/pdfs/Hypatia\_Sans\_lan...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/https:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/hypatia/pdfs/Hypatia_Sans_language_samples.pdf "https://www.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/hypatia/pdfs/Hypatia\_Sans\_language\_samples.pdf")

Optima's far more interesting sister:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/neufville/pascal-nd/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/neufville/pascal-nd/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/neufville/pascal-nd/")

hhp

[Candara](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/candara/) is about the same vintage as Beorcana. It's a Microsoft house-brand font, but I find myself using it in places where in the past I used Optima.

How about Ocean Sans?  
 [http://www.identifont.com/similar?3Q7](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.identifont.com/similar?3Q7 "http://www.identifont.com/similar?3Q7")

Perhaps: [http://www.fontspring.com/fonts/aviation-partners/beaulieu](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.fontspring.com/fonts/aviation-partners/beaulieu "http://www.fontspring.com/fonts/aviation-partners/beaulieu")  
Or edgier: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/amira/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/amira/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/amira/")

Or perhaps Proza: [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bureau-roffa/proza/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bureau-roffa/proza/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bureau-roffa/proza/")
Check this [list](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39592#comment-258784)
[Accent Graphic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.g-type.com/accent-graphic-font)

Magma is perhaps not that recent, but to paraphrase Tina Turner, "What's recent got to do with it?"

[http://www.stonetypefoundry.com/magmaoverview.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/magmaoverview.html "http://www.stonetypefoundry.com/magmaoverview.html")

I think a lot of the above don’t fit the brief of “feeling contemporary.”

Here are a couple of less “old style” feeling fonts, that still have the flares of Optima:  
Chianti [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/chianti/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/chianti/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/chianti/")  
FF Legato [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-legato/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-legato/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-legato/")

I would suggest Brown, but it is more grotesque than humanist. [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/brown/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/brown/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/brown/")

...and I will concur that my own Hypatia Sans would be a reasonable choice here:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/hypatia-sans-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/hypatia-sans-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/hypatia-sans-pro/")
[Cronos Pro?](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/cronos/regular/)
That's a nice and underrated option.

Which naturally leads to suggesting:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/today-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/today-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/today-sans/")  
:-\>

hhp
I think you are straying into alternatives to Gill rather than Optima territory with Today Sans Hrant.
I think you are straying into alternatives to Gill rather than Optima territory with Today Sans Hrant.

It's really attractive thinks.

[Clipping Path](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/clippingcreationsindia.com/)

I never thought typophile would attract spam.

Thanks for all your replies.

A nice, more calligraphic alternative to Optima is Publica by Karl-Heinz Lange, revived as PTL Publicala:  
 [http://primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=45](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418111834/http:/primetype.com/faces_info.php?fid=45 "http://primetype.com/faces\_info.php?fid=45")
